utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: What is all that?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh my lord.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Somewhere in one of these bags is the perfect baby show gift for Jen and Ryan. I just need your help picking which one. Ready? Ta da!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is that a bullet proof baby - ?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That is completely inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That – oh my.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well then you’re going to hate the onesies that say “I’m with Officer Stupid”.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard! I honestly – why can’t you just buy a simple, traditional – why is this so difficult for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not! This next one is perfect. Trust me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is it a baby sized lightsaber?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Please tell me that’s not the creepy robot nanny that sings Leonard Cohen lullabies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong with Leonard Cohen lullabies?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s more like Silence of the Lambs than “Mary had a little lamb”. Oh, don’t worry, sweetheart. Fortunately Alexis has purchased the perfect baby shower gift.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: All you have to do is sign the card.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have any idea how hard it is to find machine washable Kevlar? Why didn’t you tell me this before I went shopping?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Because we would have so missed torturing you. You are our favorite reality show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m so happy I could entertain you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, Alexis. I will drop this off at the precinct a little later.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Too bad you can’t go to the shower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well, Beckett got baby showers in the breakup, so…

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You know, that’s funny. Because you recently – you just, uh, don’t be so tortured by all that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, you know, Beckett asked for some time, so I’m just giving it to her. Every day.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sometimes twice.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I said, this is nice. Thank you so much for doing that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. No problem.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So our vic is a Russian national by the name of –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Grigory Mishkin. I spoke to the police commissioner. He’s the son of a consulate officer, which means this might get political.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie. So, what’ve we got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Throat was slashed. Live temp puts the time of death between 2 and 4AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea what our victim was doing in an abandoned building in the middle of the night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. His pockets were turned out but his wallet and his cell phone were found nearby. So the killer searched him but there’s no way to know if anything was taken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what do you make of these?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like ink that was transferred from whatever was in his shirt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See if the lab can reconstruct the characters. He might have been killed because of whatever was inside.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Howdy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Howdy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Um, yo’s getting played out, so I thought I’d try something new.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well you might want to keep trying, because howdy is just –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wrong.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I like it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, by the way, there’s a homeless guy that was camped out down the block. He heard a car roar to life and burn rubber about 2AM so I’m pulling street cam footage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, keep me posted. I’m going to head off to Russia and talk to next of kin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Russia?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, legally a consulate is considered foreign territory, so…

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. See you later.

utterance.speaker: PAVEL OBORIN
utterance.content: I’m Counsel General Pavel Oborin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Captain Kate Beckett, NYPD. Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Oborin.

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Yes, Captain. I will take you to Grigory’s father, Sergei. He hopes for a quick resolution and to see justice served.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As do we. Now, is it possible that Grigory’s father’s consulate work put his son at risk?

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Oh, Mr. Mishkin writes economic forecasts for commodities. It’s hardly a thing worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did you know Grigory?

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Oh yes. I watched him grow up. You see, for us this is very personal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand.

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Then you will be amenable to my request to have a Russian diplomatic security officer assigned to the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Oborin, I appreciate the offer but my detectives are the best in the city.

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Oh, I do not doubt that. But, still, I must insist. A spirit of cooperation is in everyone’s best interest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My condolences.

utterance.speaker: SERGEI MISHKIN
utterance.content: Thank you. Oh, please. Can you tell me what happened with Grigory?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, we’re not exactly sure just yet. Do you have any idea what he was doing in an abandoned building?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: No. I wish I did. Grigory hasn’t been himself since we lost in mother, Anya, in a car accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: The last months have been a downward spiral of drinking, drugs –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he could have been meeting with a dealer?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: I wouldn’t know. But the new crowd he was spending time with would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what crowd is this?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Diplo-brats.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Spoiled children of foreign officers who flaunt the law with diplomatic immunity. They do what they like and nobody can stop them. Grigory got lost in their world.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Meet the notorious diplo-brats of New York City. We arrest them but immunity means no prosecution.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like catch and release but without the cooler full of beer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m searching through all their files to see if there’s a connection back to our vic, but so far nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, did you hear that the Russians are sending one of their own to ride along with us?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re kidding me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Vasiliy Zhirov. He’s part of the Russian diplomatic security service.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Red Heat is coming here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Castle! Bearing gifts, I see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is your starter kit for little Kevin. Except for the Macallan 25 and the ear plugs. Those are for you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re a dear and thoughtful man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. So a Russian?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Ivan Drago’s in the house.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I hear those guys are like automatons. Strictly business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if Boris is coming could Natasha be far behind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s going to be trouble for the big moose and little squirrel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s so – He’s right behind me, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY ZHIROV
utterance.content: I know you. You’re Richard Castle, no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Such an honor!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The honor is mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I love your books. Many a flights to Moscow have been kept company by Derrick Storm.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: And Nikki Heat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Also known as Captain Beckett.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It is also an honor to meet the muse, the inspiration –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, welcome to the Twelfth, Mr. Zhirov.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Such a famous crime solving duo. It will be a privilege to watch you work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh well, sadly we don’t work together any longer.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: But it cannot be. Beckett without Castle is like uh … Boris without Natasha. It’s like Starsky without The Hutch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s just Hutch. Not The Hutch. It’s not – you said The Hutch. Uh, street cams weren’t able to get our getaway car but shot spotter was tripped by the engine noise.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: What is a spot shotter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shot spotter. An audio surveillance system designed to detect gunshots.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And noises over one hundred and twenty decibels can also activate the system so we’ve got a recording.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what? I’ll just have to get experts to tell me what kind of make and model –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No need. That is a Lamborghini Huracan. Yeah, the V10s are notorious for crackling and popping like a breakfast cereal.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jurgen Kass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The son of the Finnish ambassador has that very same car. He also has a history of drug and assault charges. Though, of course, all those charges were dropped due to his diplomatic immunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, murder doesn’t get a pass so pick him up.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you have already broken open the case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You know, I’d be glad to stick around – – but I actually have some business to attend to, so …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I should go. So …

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: JURGEN KASS
utterance.content: What’s up, 5-O?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, Jurgen. I don’t think you understand the trouble you’re in.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: Oh, please. I ain’t in trouble. I am trouble.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah, you’re a regular Scarface.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sit down. Now.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: You think you scare me, 5-O? Please. I could put my little man on this table and there’s not one thing you could do.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If I see your little man then we’re going to have a little problem.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: This guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sit down.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: You’re worried I’m here to make troubles for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … no. No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Captain, do you really want to start off this friendship with a lie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. The truth? A young man was murdered. And I don’t’ want politics to get in the way of catching the bastard who did it.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I admire your passion. Very Russian. Rest assured, I do not wish to interfere in your case. I’m as far from the political animal as one could get. Frankly, I am excited to learn from Katherine the Great. May I share a secret?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yes.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I have never been to New York and I was hoping there will be some down time to see the sights.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yes. Of course. In fact, I can bring you in for the big, important moments, otherwise the city is yours to explore.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You went for a little ride in the warehouse district.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know you were at that abandoned building last night, Jurgen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You met Grigory there to sell him drugs. And then when he stiffed you, you killed him.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: All right. I confess. I confess that uh … I’m rich, b*tches. Say cheese.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What is wrong with you? What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re the prime suspect in a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: You know I have diplomatic immunity. To charge me your state department has to ask my government permission, which they have not. But um … this has been awesome. Peace out.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: The suspect is leaving.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, cases don’t always get solved as quickly as they do in Castle’s books.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: What will you do next?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just keep digging until we find some hard evidence on Jurgen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Means that now might be a good time to go do that thing that we talked about.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’s he going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sightseeing. Looks like he won’t be a problem after all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Richard Castle Investigations.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: This is Vasiliy. I have most important news to discuss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … listen, if it’s about the case –

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. You see, I’m a writer, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you are.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I have an idea for a Nikki Heat novel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course you do.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Let’s meet for coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me – let me – I’m – I’m going to check my schedule.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vasiliy Zhirov wants me to meet him for coffee. What should I do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Keep him happy. The more time he spends with you the less he’s going to be hanging over my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if I keep him happy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then I will keep you happy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Done. Vasiliy!

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: The title of the book will be Heat and Ice. And Ice is the code name for the new Russian superspy who’s Nikki Heat’s new nemesis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Enemy from the East and new a Cold War?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Cold war, yes! But though Heat and Ice are rivals their sexual attraction is like nuclear fire!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vasiliy, I have to admit you are not at all what I expected.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: You thought I would be like Red Heat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: That is old Russia. I am new Russia!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t that our suspect?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: What a coincidence. Your detective friends didn’t have much luck questioning him. I wonder if we can do better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, maybe we should leave it alone –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we shouldn’t interfere –

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Hey. Pick up book, young man. This here is Richard Castle, one of the great mystery writers of our time. And he has a few questions for you about the murder of Grigory Mishkin.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: Ugh, get lost, Ivan. If the cops can’t touch me what are you guys going to do?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Ah, diplomatic immunity. It is like a soft fur coat that keeps you warm and cozy. In America. But, my friend, Russian justice plays by different rules.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: What is – Russian justice?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Oh, how should I describe this? Oh, yes. When you’re in Ibiza next month you might wake up on the beach. Without your feet.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: Okay. I didn’t tell this to the cops because my father gets furious when I hang with Russians.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: Our countries have bad history, you know. Look, I dropped Grigory off at that building after we took care of a little business, but I never went in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of business? Drug?

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: No. He owed me a ticket to a reception at the Russian consulate. It will be wall to wall Russian models.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes. Russian women are devastatingly beautiful. Tell me, what did you give Grigory in return for the tickets?

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: A manual. On how to hack the computer of a Cherokee automobile.

utterance.speaker: VASILY
utterance.content: This is a strange request.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he want with that?

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: He didn’t say. I swear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was he meeting in this building?

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Very well.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Have a nice day.

utterance.speaker: JURGEN
utterance.content: So uh … we’re cool, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How the hell did you get Jurgen to talk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vasiliy helped him see the value of honesty.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: What can I say? I’m a people’s person.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And why would Grigory want to hack a Cherokee?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, this might explain that. The lab deciphered those characters from the ink stain they found on Grigory’s shirt. It is a case number from a state trooper incident report for the car accident that killed Grigory’s mother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess, she was driving a Cherokee?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Correct.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: So Grigory doesn’t think her death was an accident.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That might be what got him killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to the state trooper’s report, Anya Mishkin, and our victim’s mother, died in a single vehicle crash on Highway 9 upstate near Cold Springs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Her car hit a tree and burned sometime after 1AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, a fire would cover up any evidence of a software hack causing that crime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but Castle, there’s no indication in these files that it was murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But clearly Grigory thought someone sabotaged his mother’s car in order to kill her.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: And investigating that theory got Grigory killed by the saboteur.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I couldn’t have said it better myself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to financial records, four days ago Grigory stayed in a bed and breakfast near the crash site. The same one that his mom was staying in when she died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Reach out to that bed and breakfast. See if they know what Grigory was up to.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: So it’s left to us to talk to Grigory’s father. See if he harbored suspicions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vasiliy, uh … Castle and I don’t work together any longer.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes, the news of which is more than I can bear. I may have expressed my disappointment to people you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bill! What’s up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Commissioner. No, we’re doing everything we can to assist Mr. Zhirov.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve met him. He’s a – a character. I would love to work with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I would love to have Castle work with us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Fantastic! We can stop for pizza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: JOYCE
utterance.content: Yeah, that Russian kid stayed here last week. Poor guy was asking about his mom. She loved staying here at my bed and breakfast. What a shame about the accident.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you remember about her?

utterance.speaker: JOYCE
utterance.content: Nice lady. Stayed here a few nights with a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you get his name?

utterance.speaker: JOYCE
utterance.content: Nope. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: JOYCE
utterance.content: I can do you one better. The kid was asking the same question, so I pulled security video and got – – this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Mishkin, was there anything in your son or late wife’s behavior that would merit suspicion?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: If there was I would have told security agents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was your wife doing upstate?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Um… I believe she was having an affair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With whom?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: I don’t know. We have grown apart. But we both wanted to serve at this post so we led separate lives.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: We have to go someplace. Excuse us, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll need her contact list. Along with anything else that could identify who she might have been seeing.

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Yes, of course. I’ll have it ready for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Communication office. Top secret. Alpha clearance only.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes. But not so cool if they catch you here. You’ll be shot.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It’s no joke. We must hurry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It is possibly that Grigory, even though he did not work here, kept a dedicated email account on our private servers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This’ll tell us a little bit more about his investigation into his mother’s death.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes. And there is it. I see urgent emails from emily2929 pleading for him to call her. She’s scared, states that they’re both in trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The last one was sent the day he died. But who’s emily2929?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emily Hopper. You know why you’re here?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: This is about Grigory Mishkin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was your relationship with him?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Ah. You’re about to lie. Don’t do it. It would not be good for you.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I … saw him a couple of days ago. I’d always had a thing for him, so we hooked up. But that’s it. Whatever this is about, whatever he did, I – I had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what do you think this is about, exactly?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I don’t know. Nothing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emily, Grigory is dead.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened the last time you saw him? Why did you send him emails demanding he call you?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I feel asleep after he … you know. When I woke up I thought I saw him on my laptop. He denied it, but after he left I realized that he used my work login to access a client’s data.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what kind of work do you do?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: I work with a data storage company. We archive files for business. … And some government agencies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you need to tell me what kind of files Grigory was looking at. Whatever he saw might have gotten him killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo. Come here. Close the door. Emily Hopper’s cloud storage archives old FBI files. That’s what Grigory was after.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What kind of FBI files?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A 1980s Cold War operation to identify and flip Soviet sleeper agents in the US.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sleepers? I thought the Directive S was a myth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it was very real. And the FBI’S biggest catch was KGB agent Anatoly Arkady. In ’87 he defected and went into Witness Protection as Frank Thomas. And that’s Frank, present day, still living in the US.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is our guy from the bed and breakfast.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the woman here is Grigory’s mother, Anya Mishkin. Also a Soviet agent.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s a spy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is bigger than an illicit affair gone wrong. And I’m beginning to think our friendly Russian knows more than he’s telling.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hello Vasiliy.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, can I borrow Castle and Ryan for a few minutes? It’s about Ryan’s baby shower, emergency.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: How many American men does it take to plan a baby shower?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um .. three.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pardon me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Javi, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you know if Vasiliy recognizes this guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why do you ask?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because Frank’s real name is Anatoly Arkady. He’s a defector from Russia back in the Cold War and …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: … Grigory’s mom, Anya, is a spy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. That is so coo – – bad. That is so bad. Their relationship wasn’t romantic?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not sure what their relationship was. Either way, we now know that Vasiliy’s motives cannot be trusted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A defector resurfaces, a spy dies, and her son is killed in the middle of the night. This novel writes itself.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then tell us what happens next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea. That’s what makes it so good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Frank, aka Anatoly, is the key to figuring out what’s behind these murders. So you guys dig into his life and see what you can find.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you want us to do about Vasiliy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta keep him as far away from this case as possible. Which mean, we need to launch Operation Nickel Tour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re going to take him sightseeing. See what he knows. In the meantime, I’m going to talk to the Feds, see if they’ve got any intel on Anatoly returning to active status.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello. I need my curtains cleaned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vasiliy.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Is the baby shower emergency resolved?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. And uh, good news. The boys have hours and hours of research to do, phone calls for the case, so I thought, why not take this chance to show you around this little island we call home?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It is not a critical juncture? I don’t want to be a shirker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on. A little shirking never hurt anyone. We’ll have a late lunch at Tavern on the Green and a … carriage ride around the park.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s – it’s a tradition.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: This is why you have cell phones, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly! Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I want to hear more about you. Diplomatic security sounds fascinating.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Ah, it’s like theater. Everyone pretends to be one thing when really, they’re another. And nobody cares about anything but the results.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, bosses, right? What do they know? Uh … who do you report to?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I’m sorry. My mamochka needs attention. It’s okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, listen, I know a thing or two about having a needy mamochka. Please.

utterance.speaker: VASILY
utterance.content: She is most excited I have met you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well, I’m sure an autographed copy of my latest book could be arranged.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Oh, amazing. She also requested a few souvenirs. We can go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anywhere you like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rita, thank you for meeting with me so quickly.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: I like it. Although when I ran ops in strip clubs we were open for business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, I’ve got two murders and all roads lead toward a Russian defector from the ‘80s, Anatoly Arkady.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Doesn’t ring a bell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, the FBI put him in WitPro under the name Frank Thomas and I was hoping you could put out a few quiet feelers, see if he’s working a new operation.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: I’ll take care of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: You really did it. You blew up your marriage and went down the LokSat rabbit hole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – um –

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, yeah, nothing. It’s just that, um … well, you’ve been watching us, and you think that we’re broken up.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: But you’re not. Oh, I love a little sexual subterfuge. Oh, it makes things so much hotter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Castle is playing tour guide to a Russian diplomatic security officer. His name’s Vasiliy –

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Vasiliy Zhirov?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, do you know him?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: He’s a clean North Russian Foreign Intelligence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So diplomatic security’s just a cover?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then what’s his real mission?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Who knows. But if your husband gets in Vasiliy’s way he’s going to be collateral damage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … unless your mamochka is a fan of rat droppings and dirty needles there’s really not much around here by way of souvenirs.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Her tastes can be unusual.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Actually, I lied about earlier.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow – ow. Vasiliy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did – why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Don’t worry. You’ll soon find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vasiliy?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Our carriage ride around the park with have to wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you? Obviously you’re not some happy-go-lucky diplomatic security agent.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: You remember Arnold Schwarzenegger in the movie Red Heat, yes? Compared to me his character is like weak, nonviolent child.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Hey, little sunshine. Come on. Russian intelligence picked up chatter about an attack on Russian citizens in the United States. If that happens – – dead Russians on American soil, it would be very bad for both our countries.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we take that to Homeland Security.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I cannot. Because believe the attackers are Russian. Do you understand now? I believe Anya Mishkin and this traitor are part of the conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Poor Grigory got murdered because he stumbled into it. I must break him.

utterance.speaker: ANATOLY ARKADY
utterance.content: I’m not telling you squat, – – comrade.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Do you hear that, Rick?

utterance.speaker: ANATOLY
utterance.content: You couldn’t get me to –

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Even though he lived as an American all these decades, still he’s a Russian in his heart. But I will soften him up. Like ice cream on a hot summer day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. I can’t let you do that.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Rick. You’re a nice guy. I like you. So please, don’t make me hurt you, too. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please tell me you have a line on Vasiliy and Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you ping Castle’s phone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s been deactivated.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Pain is the only way we get truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s another way.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: No there’s not!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There is always another way.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Look, I wish I had more time to humor you –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sixty seconds. Just give me sixty seconds. Please.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Sixty seconds. Fine. Show me what you got.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Obviously this would – – go a lot easier if you would tell him what he needs to know.

utterance.speaker: ANATOLY
utterance.content: Okay. What he needs to know … is that you can both go screw yourselves!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Rick, I hate to be rude but so far I’m not impressed. Fifty five seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay! Okay, okay. If – if Frank is the center of this conspiracy then he may have some clues on him as to where the attack is going to take place.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Forty two seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a receipt. There’s a receipt for a … lamination kit.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Which means what, exactly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Very good. Forty two seconds. Forty one!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. All right. His map history has a search for uniform stores. Okay, call history – he called the same number three times last week.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Twenty nine seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: This is fun, no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a caterer. Why a catering company? What am I missing?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: For time. Only twenty four seconds left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, seriously? You’re right. Okay, lamination kit is – it’s uh … you’re making fake IDs. You’re making fake IDs to get someone into a catering company. Why? To slip into an event, but what event? You’re – – the party at the Russian consulate. You’re making a fake ID to sneak someone into the party at the Russian consulate dressed as catering staff. Right?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Brilliant! And with time to spare! Actually, no. The party’s about to begin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m gonna call Beckett.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Let’s hurry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have unis pick Frank up and have her meet us at the consulate.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Bye Frank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They’re denying us entry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because this is considered Russian soil we can’t force our way in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why hasn’t the Counsel General cancelled the party yet?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: How do you say, it is not good for business. If Oborin cancelled without clearable proof it looks weak in the eyes of his adversaries.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Politics wins over death threats?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: In Russia it is better to be killed than lose face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You need to get us in. Now.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It is invite only.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So invite us. We’ll be your plus four.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what’s the plan? We don’t even know who the target is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look for anyone out of place or acting unusual.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we know that our attacker is dressed as one of the catering staff, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, not necessarily. They may have used the catering outfit to gain entry but now that they’re inside a ruthless traitor may try to blend in.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes, yes, very true. But guys, most important I vouched for you. I have street cred to protect so please, stay cool, yeah?

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: More champagne?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I’ll go get you some.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sniper!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: I – I think so. I think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody call an ambulance!

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Sergei? Sergei!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bullet went through and through. Sergei’s in surgery right now, he’s expected to make a full recovery. Anything on the shooter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we found the sniper’s nest in the building across the street from the consulate.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Any luck with security video?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Disabled, but we found a janitor’s uniform and the sniper’s weapon. It’s a Russian made Dragunov.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did CSU pull prints or DNA?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’re trying, but I don’t think they’re going to find anything. Whoever pulled this off is a pro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means IDing our shooter, who most likely killed Grigory when he found out about this whole assassination plot, is going to be damn near impossible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it only gets worse. The Russians are claiming that we created a distraction for their security team which allowed for the assassination attempt on their Counsel General.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, hold up. You save the counsel’s ass and this is the thanks we get?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Plus they are refusing any further cooperation with us on Grigory’s murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would they do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t –

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Because we’re scared. It is easier to blame America for our troubles when the truth is, we’re fighting ourselves?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is that supposed to be an apology?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It didn’t sound like one.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: The attempt on Oborin’s life has shaken everyone in the Russian diplomatic community. No one knows who to trust and what little faith Oborin has in me he has now lost.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So now that you’re all out of friends you’ve come to us for help?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Please, Captain. You told you only wanted to get the son of a b*tch behind this. Help me get justice. To Grigory, Anya, and Sergei.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. But I have to bring someone else in.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Get out of town.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Long time no see.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Since that thing at the place.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: You mean the place with the guy?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Nyet, not that guy. The other guy. The guy with the big, massive head.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Oh, that guy. I remember. Things didn’t end well for him.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: They may not end well for you, either.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Like I don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: So right here, right now. Lay all your cards on the table.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: The Russian consulate in New York has a leak.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: How bad?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Critical. Sensitive intelligence being sold at anonymously at auction. Two months ago I activated Anya Mishkin to identify the traitor.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: I’m guessing the traitor got to her first.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Anya’s last communique said she was close to unmaking him. But then she was killed in a car crash.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Your traitor silenced her. We need names. Who’s on your list?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Sharing? And then there’s sharing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she’s from the State Department?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually that’s just a cover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cover for what? Who is she?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rita is many things, one of which is … your step-mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s been helping me take down LokSat. I’m – I wanted to tell you sooner, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess. You couldn’t because you needed to protect me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is getting really old, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know. Believe me. It is … old. It’s very old.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re absolutely right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. We – – what about – – what was I right about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The report on the Dragunov sniper rifle said that the barrel twist rate was 320 millimeters but the newer version is 240, right?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes, it was changed in the ‘90s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then why would our sniper use an older model when the newer one is so much more powerful and accurate?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: It – it must have been the only thing the assassin had access to. Only, who the hell leaves around a Russian sniper rifle from the 1980s lying around?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: молния.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lightning?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It’s an old KGB code name for weapons caches planted in NATO countries to support the agents in the field. After the dissolution of the Soviet Union many we abandoned.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: But someone in the field would know where they were.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like Frank? Except he’s all lawyered up.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes, but I too know where these old caches are. We search these caches, we could find our killer.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: You remind me of Jackson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I find that very hard to believe.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: You have his eyes and that mischievous grin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Hmm. Yep, there it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How – is he?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Alive. In our business that’s all you can hope for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Has he ever, um … mentioned me?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ouch. You couldn’t have lied?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean he’s not thinking of you. It’s just how he deals with having to stay away. He does it for your own safety.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am so sick of people pushing me away for my safety.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: Specifically Beckett, I’m assuming? Still a wee bit upset, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The anger flares up from time to time, yes.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: She did it out of love.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I know. And – – at the end of the day, she’s worth it.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: I’m glad I met you, Richard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m glad I met you, too.

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: But you didn’t. Remember that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, your secret is safe. Am I going to see you or my dad again?

utterance.speaker: RITA
utterance.content: He’s so very proud of you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, you’re going to want to see this. I was scrubbing traffic cam footage at the addresses of all the old Cold War caches in the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did you find?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, you have to see it to believe it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is from yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll show you. Wait for it … Remember our Cold War spies, Anatoly and Anya? This is her now.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: This is Anya Mishkin. Grigory’s mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But she died in the car crash.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope. She’s alive and well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She must have taken the Dragunov from the gun cache. Now we know our assassin is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you expect me to believe that you had no idea Anya was alive?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I swear that for all I know Anya was the leak in the Russian consulate all along.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anya faked her own death to throw you off?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain? That BOLO that I put on the stolen car that Anya got into paid off. Unis pulled her over on the LIE.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do they have her in custody?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bringing her in right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll question her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was the end game, Anya? Money for selling secrets in a Cayman account so that you and Frank could sit on a beach?

utterance.speaker: ANYA MISHKIN
utterance.content: You have no idea what you are talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But the price for this fantasy getaway was steep: your son’s life. So who killed him? Was it Frank? Or did you do it yourself?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: Everything I’ve done was in order to save him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Grigory found out the truth, didn’t he? And he threatened to expose you. That’s why you killed him. The thing I don’t understand is, why did you stick around for the assassination attempt at the consulate?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: All I had left was vengeance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did Oborin do to you?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: I wasn’t aiming for Oborin!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sergei? You were aiming for your husband?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: And if you hadn’t interfered he would be dead now, as he should be.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: I must say, Rick, your novels don’t do Beckett justice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s just getting started.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Whew.

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: I am not the devil you think I am. I am not a traitor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But your husband is.

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: Yes. Sergei is the one who’s been selling our trade secrets to economic competitors. I have proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why didn’t you tell Vasiliy? Was it love?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: Not love. I held my tongue because my husband is very well connected. Much more so than Vasiliy.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Sadly Rick, this is all true.

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: If I had turned Sergei in he would have used his political muscle to bury me. I would have been the one on trial, not him. Laws mean nothing in Russia. All that matters is power.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you fakes your death to protect yourself. But Grigory became suspicious.

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: He got onto the truth of what Sergei was doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anya, are you saying that Sergei killed Grigory?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: They’re not blood.

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: Grigory’s biological father died before his birth and Sergei never truly bonded with Grigory. I followed Grigory to that apartment building. But I was too late. I saw Sergei running away and then I … found my poor boy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why did you try to get revenge with a sniper rifle?

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: Because Sergei never left the consulate after the murder. That night was my best chance. My last chance! Soon he will go back to Russia and be out of my reach.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I promise you I will do everything in my power to make sure that he is brought to justice.

utterance.speaker: ANYA
utterance.content: My husband has full diplomatic immunity. You are powerless, just like I am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wouldn’t be too sure about that.

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: You have no business here, Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Oborin, are you aware that Sergei has been selling Russian trade secrets?

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Captain, this is a Russian matter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he killed Grigory, just –

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: And it is a Russian matter.

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: If you’ll excuse me, I have a plane to catch. I’ve been recalled to Moscow where I shall pay a small fine and begin my retirement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A fine? That’s his punishment?

utterance.speaker: SERGEI
utterance.content: Would you do me a favor? Could you please tell my wife I said. “Алты́нного во́ра ве́шают, а полти́нного че́ствуют.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Small thieves get hanged, great ones go free. An old Russian proverb. Mr. Oborin, please. Revoke Sergei’s immunity. Have him stand trial for Grigory’s murder.

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: It would set a very dangerous example. You see, Captain, Russian justice is very, very, complicated. Oh, there is somebody who would like to say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: You two look so unhappy. This breaks my heart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re, uh … leaving town? Same plane as Sergei?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Yes. Nine hours to Moscow. But plenty of time to work on our Heat and Ice collaboration, yes? In fact – –I have an idea for the ending.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vasiliy, I don’t know if it’s –

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It goes like this: Nikki Heat and Jameson Rook think the evil Russian has gotten away. What they don’t know is that Vladimir Ice has set in motion a plan to send the murderer to live out the rest of his miserable life at the lonely Russian outpost in Oymyakon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve heard of that town. That’s the coldest place on Earth.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: It takes four days to warm the ground with burning fire before they can bury their dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that where Sergei is headed?

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: In Russia there are far worse places than prison.

utterance.speaker: OBORIN
utterance.content: Like I said, Russian justice is very complicated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Strong.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: This was fun, no?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: We do it again sometime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Call me first.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Dasvidaniya.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. Come.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you. All right.

utterance.speaker: VASILIY
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not exactly the ending I was hoping for, but I guess it’ll have to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Beckett, we’ve kissed in six different countries.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? You’re keeping count?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not? Anyway, one country we haven’t kissed in is Russia and technically, right now, we are on Russian soil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, there is one other thing that we’ve done in six different countries.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: иди сюда крошка.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It means follow me and find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Find a Russian translation app.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
